intro: Lemairea, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or subshrubs with distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered in dense inflorescences, often with a striking red or purple hue. Lemairea species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. They are characterized by their woody stems and their ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
